content.question: Consumers who get their electricity from coal-fired power plants are not paying the true cost of energy production in their monthly utility bills. Which of the following is true about utility bills for these consumers?

choices.label: The bills do not include public health costs, such as those associated with air pollution.
The bills do not include the cost of power distribution.
The bills do not include the cost of marketing electricity.
The bills include the cost of environmental damage associated with transporting coal.
The bills include the cost of cleaning up acid mine damage.

content.answer: The bills do not include public health costs, such as those associated with air pollution.
